title: Why the 2022 Padres did not get as far as the 1998 Padres
text:
creating a step chart


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(ggalt)

Padres2022 <- read_csv("Padres2022Hitting.csv") %>% mutate(Year = 2022, Team = "Padres")
Padres1998 <- read_csv("PadresHitting1998.csv") %>% mutate(Year = 1998, Team = "Padres")
baseballstats <- read_csv("baseballstats.csv")

Padres22and98 <- bind_rows(Padres2022, Padres1998)

ggplot() + 
  geom_step(
    data=Padres22and98,
    aes(y=Year, x=Runs, group=Team), 
    color="light grey") +
  geom_step(
    data=Padres2022, 
    aes(y=Year, x=Runs, group=Team), 
    color="brown") + 
  geom_step(
    data=Padres1998, 
    aes(y=Year, x=Runs, group=Team), 
    color="yellow") +
  annotate(
    "text", 
    x=(as.Date("2021-02-10")), 
    y=-70, 
    label="2022 Padres") +
  annotate(
    "text", 
    x=(as.Date("2021-03-01")), 
    y=330, 
    label="1998 Padres") +
labs(x="Total runs", y="Year", title="The 1998 Padres scored way more runs than the 2022 Padres", subtitle="The 98 Padres scored almost twice as many runs as the 22 Padres, leading them to a World Series Appearence.", caption="Source: https://www.baseball-reference.com | By Mady Vinci") + 
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
    )





creating stacked bar


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(ggalt)

Padres2022 <- read_csv("Padres2022Hitting.csv")
Padres1998 <- read_csv("PadresHitting1998.csv")
baseballstats <- read_csv("baseballstats.csv")

Padres1998Runs <- Padres1998 %>%
    TotalTeamRuns98 = sum(Runs)
Padres2022Runs <- Padres2022 %>%
    TotalTeamRuns22 = sum(Runs)

ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(
    data=Padres1998Runs, Padres2022Runs,
    aes(x=reorder(Year, TotalRuns), 
        weight=Runs, 
        fill=Type)) + 
  coord_flip()
  ) +
labs(x="Total runs", y="Year", title="The 1998 Padres scored way more runs than the 2022 Padres", subtitle="The 98 Padres scored almost twice as many runs as the 22 Padres, leading them to a World Series Appearence.", caption="Source: https://www.baseball-reference.com | By Mady Vinci") + 
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
    )


creating a lollipopchart


Code
ggplot() + 
  geom_lollipop(
    data=Padres1998Runs, Padres2022Runs, 
    aes(y=reorder(Year, Runs), x=Runs), 
    horizontal = TRUE
    ) + 
  geom_lollipop(
    data=Padres2022Runs,
    aes(y=Year, x=Runs),
    horizontal = TRUE,
    color = "brown"
      ) + 
  geom_lollipop(
    data=Padres1998Runs,
    aes(y=Year, x=Runs),
    horizontal = TRUE,
    color = "yellow"
  ) +
labs(x="Total runs", y="Year", title="The 1998 Padres scored way more runs than the 2022 Padres", subtitle="The 98 Padres scored almost twice as many runs as the 22 Padres, leading them to a World Series Appearence.", caption="Source: https://www.baseball-reference.com | By Mady Vinci") + 
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 16, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank()
    )
